attributes.action: Prosecute people profitting on Baby essentials during the corona virus epidemic.
attributes.additional_details: Mothers are struggling to find milk to feed their babies and as a result have been reduced to asking on social media for help, while people are selling milk and other essentials for extortionate prices, causing even more shortages and poverty.
attributes.background: Threaten to or prosecute people selling Baby milk, nappies and wipes for profit during shortages due to the Coronavirus panic buying.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament are not responsible for the price of consumer goods.

We have published petitions calling for similar actions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce limits on per customer purchases in all supermarkets: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766

Bring out ration books for food, everyday items and baby items: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302823

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
